alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Camden, northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Philadelphia and southeastern Delaware Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Swarthmore, or 11 miles west of Gloucester City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Chester, Deptford, West Deptford, Bellmawr, Yeadon, Woodbury, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Paulsboro, Westville, Woodbury Heights, National Park, East Lansdowne, Brooklawn, Audubon Park, Darby Township and Gibbstown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 5 and 19. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 347 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 28. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
